Generation V.Black: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
Generation V.White: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
Generation V.Black 2: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.
Generation V.White 2: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

Generation VI.X: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
Generation VI.Y: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

Generation VII.Sun: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
Generation VII.Moon: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can't defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it's intelligent, obedient to its Trainer's commands, and easy to raise.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won't forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Training Lowlands Fields of Honor ( Max Raid Battle )
